You might need to either make the shell a login shell (so .profile gets read) or rename .profile to .bashrc (but note that this'll get read every time you run bash)

`bash -l` loads bash as login shell -> .profile* is searched first. To make term act as login shell, M-x customize-group shell . There is "explicit Bash args", add -l there. Now your term will start as -l option would given.
